thread.title: Leading Student Financial Services Platform Makes C-Suite Hire to Support Fast Growth in Higher Education

author: cnbc.com
title: Leading Student Financial Services Platform Makes C-Suite Hire to Support Fast Growth in Higher Education
text:
CHANDLER, Ariz., March 5, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- CampusLogic, higher education's leading student financial services platform, today announced that Allison Duquette has joined the company's executive leadership team as Chief Revenue Officer. An executive with deep experience in education technology, Duquette joins as the firm just announced a four-year compounded annual growth rate of 215 percent.
"Allison brings considerable depth and breadth in many functional areas across education technology, including strategic planning, sales, marketing, and operations," said Gregg Scoresby, CEO of CampusLogic. "Her success at some of the most innovative education companies will serve us well as we continue to develop the most-relied upon platform to help colleges and universities improve student financial services."
Duquette will lead sales and marketing at CampusLogic, to build on the firm's rapid growth in 2017. Prior to joining CampusLogic, she led the global sales and marketing team for the campus commerce and security business unit with Blackboard Inc., one of the largest education technology companies in the world. Previously, she has held senior roles in market-leading organizations including Pearson, Think Through Learning, Spectrum K-12, and National Computer Systems.
"The financial aid process can be cumbersome and confusing for families—but there is tremendous promise for technology to help simplify the process for both students and schools," said Duquette. "I'm very inspired by CampusLogic's mission to serve such a pressing need in our country today and look forward to working with the excellent team here."
CampusLogic works with more than 440 colleges and universities nationwide to increase access to higher education, reduce borrowing, and drive down the cost of financial aid administration. The CampusLogic student financial services platform enables students and families to understand the true cost of college early in the enrollment process, complete critical financial aid forms, and access easy-to-understand, digital award letters. In 2017 alone, schools used CampusLogic's platform to send nearly 1 million mobile award offers, 2.6 million text messages, and 3.3 million emails to students.
About CampusLogic
CampusLogic transforms the way higher education delivers student financial services with the first—and only—comprehensive platform. Easy. Mobile. Personalized. CampusLogic's innovative software removes barriers from the student finance journey for a faster, more efficient path to enrollment and retention. More than 440 schools serving 3 million students boost enrollment, streamline efficiencies, and improve retention by using CampusLogic to simplify the student financial services journey. For more information visit www.campuslogic.com .
